title: (x) Curly script monogram font found on embroidery sites - custom {Mike Y}
content:
Hello,

Does anyone have any idea what ttf this is? I've seen it on several embroidery sites, but it's just called curly script or classic monogram, etc.

Thank you in advance for any help or pointers.

Bobbi Jo

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141104203750im_/http:/typophile.com/files/curly%20script_5251.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [curly script.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141104203750/http:/typophile.com/files/curly%20script_0.jpg) | 10.7 KB |
author: thriftymama

comments.content:
I think these are designed for embroidery machines and not computers. Harold Lohner has about the best collection of Monogram fonts I know and his [Vine Monograms](http://web.archive.org/web/20141104203750/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=HAFO-VIMO) are as close to your sample as i can recall.

- Mike Yanega

Hello Mike,

Thanks so much for your response. Yes, I love Harold's monogram fonts. Just purchased his original monogram set a few weeks ago and it works great for embroidery lettering. :)

I don't have his vine font, but it's tempting. :)

I'll keep searching for this one and hopefully if it doesn't exist in ttf format yet maybe someone will do it eventually. Wish I knew how...

Thanks again!  
Bobbi Jo
